conversation.content: Okay so here's the thing, I manage a ticket office all day long but somehow I can't get my own concert refund processed, isn't that just perfect?
Hmm, that is pretty ironic! Let me pull up your account here... okay so I'm seeing transaction ID TXN-4892-BQL from October 15th for the cancelled show, is that the one we're looking at?
Yes exactly that one! October fifteenth, hundred and sixty dollars, two tickets, cancelled show, should be simple right?

So basically what I'm finding here is... that's weird actually, the refund request RFQ-7261-XMP shows it was initiated on October 20th but it's stuck in this pending verification status, which honestly shouldn't happen.
Hmm wait what if it's because I used two different cards, would that mess things up somehow?
Oh! Let me see here... you're absolutely right, I'm showing payment method PM-A ends in 4782 and PM-B ends in 9301, and the system's trying to process the full refund to just the first card.
Okay so that means they're trying to put a hundred sixty on a card with only a fifty dollar limit?
Exactly.
Well that explains it! Let me see here, can we just split it back the way it came, fifty and hundred ten?

So here's where it gets a bit... *sigh* I'm really sorry but once a refund enters verification status code VST-99, we can't modify the payment distribution without cancelling and restarting the whole process.
Wait I'm confused, cancelling means starting over from scratch or cancelling means I lose the refund?

Oh no no, sorry, I should've been clearerâ€”so basically we'd cancel this stuck request and immediately create a new one with reference number REF-3847-NVZ that properly splits between your two cards.
Hmm okay but then how long, because I process refunds all day and ours take forever?
Right right.
Let me think, our system takes five to seven days, so yours probably... wait no that can't be right?

So... *exhale* I'm gonna be totally honest here, standard processing is seven to ten business days, but like, given that this has already been stuck since October 20th, I'm putting priority flag PF-EXPEDITE on your case.
Okay so that means what, three days, five days, I'm just trying to understand the timeline here?
With the expedite code, you're looking at two to three business days max, and I'm also adding a note here that you work in ticketing yourself so you know how these systems can be.
Oh that's actually really helpful, thank you! Hmm what if it gets stuck again though?

So basically if you don't see movement by Thursday, reference this case number CSE-8924-TQM when you call back, and any rep will see my notes about the dual payment method issue and the priority status, which should prevent another verification loop.

scenario: ticket office manager, ironic that she deals with tickets all day but can't fix her own refund
